data.title: Celebrity deaths 2022: All the actors, singers and more we lost this year
data.meta_description: Memorializing the celebrities â€” from actors to singers and more, like Coolio, Ray Liotta, Naomi Judd, and Bob Saget  â€” who died in 2022.
data.text:
Hollywood is in mourning in the new year over the deaths of celebrities including Ray Liotta, Paul Sorvino and Donald Trumpâ€™s first wife, Ivana Trump.

Below, Page Six remembers the actors, singers and other stars weâ€™ve lost in 2022.

Barbara Walters

Sept. 25, 1929 â€“ Dec. 30, 2022

Legendary journalist Barbara Walters died on Dec. 30 in New York City at age 93.

â€œBarbara Walters passed away peacefully in her home surrounded by loved ones,â€ the former â€œViewâ€ co-hostâ€™s rep told Page Six. â€œShe lived her life with no regrets. She was a trailblazer not only for female journalists, but for all women.â€

She is survived by daughter Jacqueline.

Sonya Eddy

June 17, 1967 â€“ Dec. 19, 2022

â€œGeneral Hospitalâ€ actress Sonya Eddy passed away in December. She was 55.

Actress Octavia Spencer announced the news on her Instagram, writing, â€œMy friend @sonyaeddy passed away last night. The world lost another creative angel. Her legions of @generalhospitalabc fans will miss her ğŸ’”ğŸ•Šï¸,â€ Spencer captioned a professional headshot of Eddy.

â€œMy thoughts and prayers are with her loved ones, friends, and fans!â€

Celebrity deaths 2023: Actors, singers and stars we lost this year

Stephen â€œtWitchâ€ Boss

Sept. 29, 1982 â€“ Dec. 13, 2022

Beloved â€œEllen DeGeneres Showâ€ DJ Stephen â€œtWitchâ€ Boss died by suicide on Dec. 13, Page Six confirmed.

Law enforcement sources told TMZ that Boss, who got his start on â€œSo You Think You Can Danceâ€ in 2008, was found dead in a Los Angeles hotel room with an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

Boss was married to fellow pro dancer Allison Holker, and the pair shared three children â€” Weslie, Maddox and Zaia.

Ronnie Turner

Oct. 27, 1960 â€“ Dec. 8, 2022

Tina Turnerâ€™s son Ronnie passed away at age 62 in December. Although his cause off death is not yet known, Ronnie had been battling health issues in recent years, including cancer.

He is survived by his wife, Afida, who confirmed the news in an emotional statement.

â€œThis is a tragedy u with your brother craig and your father ike turner and aline rest in paradise ğŸ™ğŸ™ğŸ™ğŸ™ğŸ™â¤ï¸ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ’”ğŸ’” so unfair,â€ she wrote on Instagram.

Kirstie Alley

Jan. 12, 1951 â€“ Dec. 5, 2022

Kirstie Alley died on Dec. 5 at age 71.

Her children â€” son William â€œTrueâ€ Stevenson and daughter Lillie Price Stevenson â€” announced the news with a statement shared via their motherâ€™s social media accounts, saying she â€œpassed away after a battle with cancer, only recently discovered.â€

â€œShe was surrounded by her closest family and fought with great strength, leaving us with a certainty of her never-ending joy of living and whatever adventures lie ahead,â€ the statement read.

Alley found fame playing Rebecca Howe in the NBC sitcom â€œCheersâ€ from 1987 to 1993. She went on to star in dozens of movies and television shows, including â€œDrop Dead Gorgeous,â€ â€œVeronicaâ€™s Closet,â€ â€œIt Takes Two,â€ â€œShoot to Killâ€ and â€œLook Whoâ€™s Talking.â€

Brad William Henke

April 10, 1966 â€“ Nov. 29, 2022

â€œOrange Is the New Blackâ€ star Brad William Henke passed away in his sleep at the age of 56.

While his cause of death is still unknown, Henkeâ€™s manager, Mat DelPiano, told TMZ that â€œBrad was an incredibly kind man of joyous energy.â€

â€œA very talented actor, he loved being a part of this community â€¦ and we loved him back. Our thoughts are with his wife and family.â€

Christine McVie

July 12, 1943 â€“ Nov. 30, 2022

Fleetwood Mac confirmed on Nov. 30 via Twitter that co-vocalist and keyboardist Christine McVie had died.

â€œShe was truly one-of-a-kind, special and talented beyond measure,â€ the band said in part in a joint statement. â€œShe was the best musician anyone could have in their band and the best friend anyone could have in their life.â€

McVieâ€™s family also shared a statement that disclosed the musician died after a battle with a â€œshort illness.â€ She was 79.

Jake Flint

1985-Nov. 28, 2022

Jake Flint, a country music singer based in Oklahoma, died in November mere hours after getting married to his wife, Brenda. He was 37.

â€œWe should be going through wedding photos but instead I have to pick out clothes to bury my husband in,â€ she wrote on Facebook.

â€œPeople arenâ€™t meant to feel this much pain. My heart is gone and I just really need him to come back. I canâ€™t take much more. I need him here.â€

Irene Cara

March 18, 1959-Nov. 25, 2022

Performer Irene Cara died of unknown causes at age 63 in November. She began performing as a child, appearing on television shows and playing the title character Sparkle Williams in the original 1976 musical drama â€œSparkle.â€

Her best-known screen role was aspiring singer and actress Coco Hernandez in the gritty 1980 film, â€œFame.â€

In 1984, Cara won an Oscar for co-writing the song â€œFlashdanceâ€¦What a Feelingâ€ for the movie â€œFlashdance.â€

Nicki Aycox

May 26, 1975-Nov. 16, 2022

â€œSupernaturalâ€ actress Nicki Aycox, who played Meg Masters on the CW series, died in November at age 47. Although an official cause of death had not been shared, Aycox battled leukemia and documented her highs and lows with the disease on social media.

â€œMy beautiful, smart, fierce, incredibly talented, and loving sister-in-law, Nicki Aycox Raab, passed away yesterday with my brother, Matt Raab, by her side,â€ her sister-in-law, Susan Raab Ceklosky, wrote on Facebook alongside a series of photos.

â€œNicki and Matt had a wonderful life together in California. She was definitely a fighter and everyone who knew her loved her .â€

Jason David Frank

Sept. 4, 1973- Nov. 20, 2022

Jason David Frank, who portrayed Tommy Oliver â€“ the original Green and White Ranger â€“ in â€œMighty Morphin Power Rangers,â€ passed away at the age of 49.

â€œPlease respect the privacy of his family and friends during this horrible time as we come to terms with the loss of such a wonderful human being,â€ Justine Hunt said in a statement to TMZ on Nov. 20.

â€œHe loved his family, friends and fans very much. He will truly be missed.â€

Aaron Carter

Dec. 7, 1987- Nov. 5,2022

Aaron Carter was found dead at his home in California on Nov. 5, his rep confirmed to Page Six at the time. His housekeeper reportedly found him unconscious inside of his bathtub. He was 34 years old.

Takeoff

June 18, 1994-Nov. 1, 2022

Migos rapper Takeoff, whose government name is Kirshnik Khari Ball, was killed in a fatal shooting in the early morning of Nov. 1 at a private event at a bowling alley in Houston. He was 28.

Leslie Jordan

April 29, 1955-Oct. 24, 2022

Beloved comedian Leslie Jordan died in Hollywood on Oct. 24, his rep confirmed to Page Six. The â€œWill & Graceâ€ alum was reportedly driving when he suffered a medical emergency and crashed his BMW into a building. He was 67 at the time of his death.

Zuri Craig

July 20, 1978-Oct. 21, 2022

Musician and actor Zuri Craig passed away at 44 years old on Oct. 21, 2022, according to a statement released by his family. His cause of death was not initially made known.

Craig rose to fame as a finalist on â€œAmericanâ€™s Got Talent,â€ which he appeared on in 2015 alongside collaborator Jeffrey Lewis as part of the Craig Lewis Band.

His first big break had come in 2009 upon the bandâ€™s being discovered by Tyler Perry, who hired the duo to work on a series of â€œMadeaâ€ productions including â€œMadeaâ€™s Big Happy Family,â€ â€œMadea Gets a Jobâ€ and â€œA Madea Christmas.â€

Prior to his death, Craig had been gearing up to produce a live TV show, â€œSoul Food Live,â€ out of Atlanta beginning next month.

â€œIt is with profound sadness that we announce the transition of our beloved son, brother and friend, Zuri Craig,â€ read his familyâ€™s statement. â€œWe thank you in advance for your prayers. Please honor our privacy at this unimaginable time of mourning.â€

Robbie Coltrane

March 30, 1950-Oct. 14, 2022

â€œHarry Potterâ€ actor Robbie Coltrane, who played Rubeus Hagrid in the beloved film series, died at age 72 on Oct. 14.

Coltraneâ€™s agent confirmed that he died at a hospital in Scotland, but did not immediately reveal his cause of death.

Angela Lansbury

Oct. 16, 1925-Oct. 11, 2022

Dame Angela Lansbury died â€œpeacefully in her sleepâ€ on Oct. 11, 2022, just five days shy of her 97th birthday, her children announced in a statement that same day.

The actress is best known for her starring role as sleuth Jessica Fletcher in â€œMurder, She Wrote,â€ which ran from 1984 to 1986.

Eileen Ryan

Oct. 16, 1927-Oct. 9, 2022

Legendary actress Eileen Ryan died on Oct. 9 at the age of 94 in her home in Malibu, Calif., a spokesperson for the starâ€™s famous family announced.

She would have been 95 on Oct. 16.

Additional information, including the cause and manner of her death, was not immediately available.

Ryan was mom to actors Sean Penn and Chris Penn, who died in 2006 at the age of 40, as well as musician Michael Penn.

She was also married to late actor and director Leo Penn for over four decades.

Loretta Lynn

April 14, 1932-Oct. 4, 2022

Country music icon Loretta Lynn died on Oct. 4. She was 90.

The â€œCoal Minerâ€™s Daughterâ€ singerâ€™s family revealed she â€œpassed away peacefullyâ€ in her sleep at her â€œbeloved ranchâ€ in Tennessee.

The Grammy winner and Presidential Medal of Freedom recipient is survived by four of her six children.

Coolio

Aug. 1, 1963 â€“ Sept. 28, 2022

Coolio â€” whose real name is Artis Leon Ivey Jr. â€” died on Sept. 28 at age 59 following a suspected cardiac arrest.

His longtime manager, Jarez, confirmed the news shortly after. According to him, the rapper was at a friendâ€™s home when he suddenly collapsed. He was pronounced dead by paramedics.

Robert Cormier

June 14, 1989-Sept. 23, 2022

Robert Cormier, who played Finn Cotter on the show â€œHeartland,â€ died on Sept 23, at age 33.

â€œRobert was an athlete, an actor, and a great brother,â€ his obituary read, adding that he had â€œa passion for helping others and was always looking to achieve more.â€

â€œHe enjoyed movie nights with his family, and looked up greatly to his father. He impacted many people throughout his life whether it was family, teammates and friends. Robâ€™s memory will live on through his passion for art and film; as well as his three sisters who meant the world to him.â€

Queen Elizabeth II

April 21, 1926-Sept. 8, 2022

The royal family announced on Sept. 8 that Queen Elizabeth II died peacefully at Balmoral.

â€œThe Queen died peacefully at Balmoral this afternoon,â€ the royal family tweeted. â€œThe King and The Queen Consort will remain at Balmoral this evening and will return to London tomorrow.â€

The tragic announcement came hours after the family revealed that doctors were â€œconcernedâ€ about Elizabethâ€™s health and placed her â€œunder medical supervision.â€

She was the longest-running monarch in British history.

Jan Josephs

Sept. 5, 1947-Aug. 26, 2022

Jan Josephs, the first husband of â€œReal Housewives of New Jerseyâ€ star Margaret Josephs, died â€œunexpectedlyâ€ of a reported heart attack on Aug. 26 just days before his 75th birthday.

â€œA piece of us died with him. We are heartbroken,â€ Margaret announced in a Sept. 5 Instagram post.

The Bravolebrity said she and her ex â€œshared a beautiful conversationâ€ the night before he passed in which they â€œbraggedâ€ about how â€œblessedâ€ they felt to have children so â€œsuccessful and happy.â€

Robert LuPone

July 29, 1946-Aug. 27, 2022

Robert LuPone, the brother of Broadway icon Patti LuPone, passed away after a three-year battle with pancreatic cancer.

Robert was well known for his career on off-Broadway as well as Broadway and even earned a name for himself for playing Tony Sopranoâ€™s next-door neighbor on the HBO hit series.

Robyn Griggs

April 30, 1973- Aug. 13, 2022

Robyn Griggs, a television and film star best known for her roles on soap operas â€œAnother Worldâ€ and â€œOne Life To Live,â€ died at the age of 49 on Aug. 13.

â€œHi everyone, With a heavy heart, I am saddened to announce Robynâ€™s passing,â€ a post shared to her official Facebook read, confirming the news.

Griggs was diagnosed with stage 4 cervical cancer in 2020.

Teddy Ray

July 30, 1990-Aug. 12, 2022

Teddy Ray, a rising voice on the comedy scene, died Aug. 12, just two weeks after turning 32 years old.

Rayâ€™s death was confirmed by Comedy Central, who shared a snap of the comedian on-stage via Twitter alongside caption, â€œTeddy Ray was a hilarious and beloved performer. Heâ€™ll be deeply missed by the entire comedy community.â€

The comic was found floating in a swimming pool and died in an apparent drowning, TMZ reported at the time.

Anne Heche

May 25, 1969-Aug. 12, 2022

Anne Heche died on Aug. 12 at age 53 after getting into a fiery car crash in LA.

â€œWe have lost a bright light, a kind and most joyful soul, a loving mother, and a loyal friend. Anne will be deeply missed but she lives on through her beautiful sons, her iconic body of work, and her passionate advocacy,â€ Hecheâ€™s rep told Page Six.

Heche slipped into a coma after the crash and soon became brain dead. The Los Angeles Police Department reportedly determined that Heche was under the influence of cocaine at the time of the accident.

The actress is survived by her son, Homer Laffoon, whom she shared with ex-husband Coleman â€œColeyâ€ Laffoon, and son Atlas Heche Tupper, whom she shared with her â€œMen in Treesâ€ co-star, James Tupper.

Olivia Newton-John

Sept. 26, 1948-Aug. 8, 2022

Actress Olivia Newton-John died â€œpeacefullyâ€ in her home on Aug. 8, her husband, John Easterling, announced on social media.

â€œOlivia has been a symbol of triumphs and hope for over 30 years sharing her journey with breast cancer,â€ Easterlingâ€™s statement read, in part. â€œHer healing inspiration and pioneering experience with plant medicine continues with the Olivia Newton-John Foundation Fund, dedicated to researching plant medicine and cancer.

Newton-John is also survived by daughter Chloe Lattanzi.

Tony Dow

April 13, 1975 â€“ July 27, 2022

â€œLeave It to Beaverâ€ actor Tony Dow died on July 27 at the age of 77.

His death came a day after his wife mistakenly notified the actorâ€™s team that he had passed while in hospice care.

A statement shared on his Facebook page read, â€œWe have received confirmation from Christopher, Tonyâ€™s son, that Tony passed away earlier this morning, with his loving family at his side to see him through this journey.

â€œWe know that the world is collectively saddened by the loss of this incredible man. He gave so much to us all and was loved by so many. One fan said it bestâ€”â€™It is rare when there is a person who is so universally loved like Tony.â€™â€

Paul Sorvino

April 13, 1939 â€“ July 25, 2022

â€œGoodfellasâ€ star Paul Sorvino died of natural causes on July 25 at the age of 83.

â€œSorvino passed from natural causes and had dealt with health issues over the past few years,â€ his rep said in a statement to Page Six.

His wife Dee Dee was by his side when he passed away.

â€œOur hearts are broken, there will never be another Paul Sorvino, he was the love of my life, and one of the greatest performers to ever grace the screen and stage.â€ his wife said.

Shonka Dukureh

Sept. 4, 1977 â€“ July 21, 2022

Shonka Dukureh, who portrayed Big Mama Thornton in Baz Luhrmannâ€™s â€œElvisâ€ biopic, died on July 21, police confirmed. She was 44.

The musician was found dead inside her bedroom in the Nashville, Tenn., apartment that she shared with her two children, according to a tweet by the Metro Nashville Police Department.

No foul play is suspected in her death.

Ivana Trump

Feb. 20, 1949 â€“ July 14, 2022

Ivana Trump was found dead in her NYC apartment on July 14 at 73 years old. The first wife of former president Donald Trump reportedly went into cardiac arrest and medical personnel were not able to revive her when they arrived at the scene.

â€œShe was a wonderful, beautiful and amazing woman, who led a great an inspirational life,â€ the former president wrote in a statement announcing his exâ€™s passing.

Mary Mara

September 21, 1960 â€“ June 26, 2022

Veteran actress Mary Mara died on June 26 the age of 61 after drowning in the St. Lawrence River in New York.

New York State Police troopers responded to a call of a possible drowning that morning in the town of Cape Vincent, where she lived.

Once on the scene, police found her body â€” which they said showed no signs of foul play â€” in the water.

Mara was reportedly staying at her sisterâ€™s summer home, which fronts the river, when she decided to go for a swim.

She leaves behind an ex-husband and stepdaughter, her manager told us.

Cooper Noriega

June 28, 2002 â€“ June 9, 2022

TikTok star Cooper Noriega was found dead in his car in a Los Angeles-area parking lot in June 2022 just hours after posting a chilling video about dying â€œyoung af.â€

The 19-year-old had been open with his 1.7 million TikTok followers about his struggle with mental health issues and drug abuse.

His cause of death is still unknown.

Ray Liotta

Dec. 18, 1954 â€“ May 26, 2022

Goodfellasâ€ star Ray Liotta died in his sleep at age 67 on May 26, 2022 in the Dominican Republic where he was filming â€œDangerous Waters.â€

TMZ also reported that no one suspects foul play in the actorâ€™s shocking death.

He is survived by fiancÃ©e Jacy Nittolo and his daughter Karsen, whom he shared with ex-wife Michelle Grace.

Kailia Posey

April 19, 2006 â€“ May 1, 2022

â€œToddlers & Tiarasâ€ star Kailia Posey died on May 1, her mom announced on Facebook. She was 16 years old.

â€œI donâ€™t have words or any thoughts. A beautiful baby girl is gone,â€ she wrote. â€œPlease give us privacy as we mourn the loss of Kailia. My baby forever.â€

She did not disclose a cause of death.

Naomi Judd

Jan. 11, 1946 â€“ April 30, 2022

Naomi Judd, one half of The Judds, one of the most successful acts in country music history, died in April at the age of 76.

â€œToday we sisters experienced a tragedy. We lost our beautiful mother to the disease of mental illness,â€ Juddâ€™s daughters, Wynonna and Ashley, announced in a statement. â€œWe are shattered. We are navigating profound grief and know that as we loved her, she was loved by her public. We are in unknown territory.â€

Gilbert Gottfried

Feb. 28, 1955 â€“ April 12, 2022

Legendary actor and comedian Gilbert Gottfried died â€œafter a long illness,â€ his family announced on April 12.

â€œIn addition to being the most iconic voice in comedy, Gilbert was a wonderful husband, brother, friend and father to his two young children,â€ the statement read. â€œAlthough today is a sad day for all of us, please keep laughing as loud as possible in Gilbertâ€™s honor.â€

Gottfried was 67 at the time of his death.

Tom Parker

Aug. 4, 1988 â€“ March 30, 2022

The Wanted singer Tom Parker died in March 2022, after being diagnosed with terminal brain cancer in October 2020.

â€œOur hearts are broken, Tom was the centre of our world and we canâ€™t imagine life without his infectious smile and energetic presence,â€ his wife, Kelsey, posted on Instagram after announcing his passing. â€œWe are truly thankful for the outpouring of love and support and ask that we all unite to ensure Tomâ€™s light continues to shine for his beautiful children.â€

Parker also leaves behind two young children.

Taylor Hawkins

Feb. 17, 1972 â€“ March 25, 2022

Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins was found dead in a Colombian hotel on March 25 at the age of 50.

â€œThe Foo Fighters family is devastated by the tragic and untimely loss of our beloved Taylor Hawkins,â€ the band wrote on Twitter. â€œHis musical spirit and infectious laughter will live on with all of us forever.â€

Hawkinsâ€™ cause of death is still under investigation. There were multiple drugs found in the room where he died, according to a report out of Colombia which cited official sources.

William Hurt

March 20, 1950 â€“ March 13, 2022

â€œBig Chillâ€ actor William Hurt died on March 13, just one week shy of his 72nd birthday.

â€œHe died peacefully, among family, of natural causes,â€ his son William said in a statement. â€œThe family requests privacy at this time.â€

Hurt was diagnosed with terminal prostate cancer in 2018.

Charles Criss

April 1985 â€“ Feb. 2022

Darren Crissâ€™ older brother Charles Criss died by suicide at the age of 36 in February 2022.

â€œWe will never know just how long he was fighting this war within himself, but last week, it consumed him fully, and he succumbed by taking his own life,â€ the â€œGleeâ€ alum wrote in a post to Instagram in March 2022.

He described his brother as â€œvibrant, special, worldly, hilarious, insightful, gifted, intelligent, celebrated and adored.â€

Chris Huvane

June 29, 1974 â€“ Feb. 6, 2022

Beloved Hollywood manager Chris Huvane died by suicide in February after a years-long battle with depression. He was 47.

â€œWe are devastated beyond words this morning, Chris was simply â€˜the best of the best,â€™â€ Management 360 partners said in a statement to Deadline Monday.

â€œA brilliant manager, consummate colleague and friend, a rock of our company and our culture, beloved by every single person who ever met him. Itâ€™s an incalculable loss and our hearts go out to his family and friends.

â€œWe are all better for having known Chris, and we commit to honoring his legacy every day forward.â€

Louie Anderson

March 24, 1953- Jan. 21, 2022

Famed comedian Louie Anderson died in January after a battle with cancer, his publicist confirmed. He was 68.

The â€œBasketsâ€ star passed away in Las Vegas, where he had entered hospital earlier this week for treatment of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

Meat Loaf

Sept. 27, 1947 â€“ Jan. 20, 2022

Legendary singer Meat Loaf passed away in January at age 74 surrounded by his wife and daughters, his official Facebook page announced.

â€œWe know how much he meant to so many of you and we truly appreciate all of the love and support as we move through this time of grief in losing such an inspiring artist and beautiful man,â€ the post read. â€œWe thank you for your understanding of our need for privacy at this time. From his heart to your soulsâ€¦donâ€™t ever stop rocking!â€

AndrÃ© Leon Talley

Oct. 16, 1948 â€“ Jan. 18, 2022

Fashion legend AndrÃ© Leon Talley, who served as Vogueâ€™s creative director and editor-at-large, died at age 73 after an unknown illness.

His death was confirmed by his friend Darren Walker, the president of the Ford Foundation.

â€œAndrÃ© Leon Talley was a singular force in an industry that he had to fight to be recognized in,â€ Mr. Walker said in a statement, calling him a â€œcreative geniusâ€ and noting his ability to craft a persona for himself out of â€œa deep academic understanding of fashion and design.â€

Jordan Cashmyer

May 1, 1995 â€“ January 2022

â€œ16 and Pregnantâ€ alum Jordan Cashmyer tragically died at the age of 26. The former reality star, who appeared on the MTV show in 2014, died on Jan. 15.

â€œLast night I received a call no parent ever wants,â€ her mother, Jessica Cashmyer, wrote in a statement on Facebook. â€œMy oldest beloved daughter, Jordan has passed away, she was only 26 years old. Our hearts are truly broken. No parent should ever have to go through losing a child, EVER.â€

â€œPlease keep my family in your thoughts prayers as we navigate through this terrible tragedy,â€ the statement continued. â€œPlease understand and respect our privacy at this time. We are surrounded by the love and support of our children, grand daughter [sic] Lyla and family members.â€

The cause of death was not immediately confirmed for Jordan, who died in Maryland, per Variety.

Clint Arlis

July 29, 1987 â€“ January 2022

Former â€œBacheloretteâ€ contestant Clint Arlis passed away in mid-January. He was 34.

â€œIt is with great sadness, to tell you that my family has lost my best friend and older brother Clint on the morning of January 11th,â€ Arlisâ€™ sister wrote on Facebook. â€œPlease respect our familyâ€™s privacy as we try to cope with this great loss.â€

Arlis competed for Kaitlyn Bristoweâ€™s heart during Season 11 of the dating competition series. He was eliminated from the show in its third week.

Bob Saget

May 17, 1956 â€“ Jan. 9, 2022

Bob Saget died on Jan. 9 at age 65. According to the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s Department, the â€œFull Houseâ€ actor was found dead in his hotel room at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando, Fla. His cause of death was not immediately revealed.

Sidney Poitier

Feb. 20, 1927-January 2022

Academy Award-winning actor Sidney Poitier died at the age of 94, Bahamian Minister of Foreign Affairs Fred Mitchell announced on Jan. 7. His cause of death was not immediately confirmed.

Poitier was a staple in Hollywood for 71 years, appearing in iconic films including â€œA Raisin in the Sunâ€ and â€œGuess Whoâ€™s Coming to Dinner.â€ He won the Oscar for Best Actor for his role in â€œLilies of the Fieldâ€ in 1963, and was later given an Honorary Academy Award in 2001.

Peter Bogdanovich

July 30, 1939-Jan. 6, 2022

Filmmaker and historian Peter Bogdanovich died at age 82 on Jan. 6 from natural causes.

Bogdanovich most famously directed the 1971 drama â€œThe Last Picture Show,â€ which received eight Oscar nominations. He also helmed 1973â€™s â€œPaper Moon,â€ 1981â€™s â€œThey All Laughedâ€ and 1985â€™s â€œMask,â€ among other films.

Bogdanovich was an actor as well, appearing in â€œThe Sopranosâ€ and 2018â€™s â€œThe Other Side of the Wind.â€

Kim Mi-soo

March 16, 1992-Jan. 5, 2022

South Korean actress Kim Mi-soo died at age 29 on Jan. 5. The cause was not immediately released.

Mi-soo was known for her role in the JTBC series â€œSnowdrop.â€ She had also started filming the Disney+ show â€œSixth Sense Kissâ€ before her death.

Joan Copeland

June 1, 1922-Jan. 4, 2022

Broadway star Joan Copeland died at age 99 on Jan. 4.

The younger sister of playwright Arthur Miller made a name for herself with roles in the 1976 revival of â€œPal Joeyâ€ her brotherâ€™s 1981 play â€œThe American Clock.â€ Copeland also starred in soap operas including â€œSearch for Tomorrowâ€ and â€œOne Life to Live.â€

Jay Weaver

July 18, 1979-Jan. 2, 2022

Big Daddy Weave bassist Jay Weaver died at age 42 on Jan. 2 of COVID-19 complications.

Max Julien

July 12, 1933-Jan. 1, 2022

Actor Max Julien died at age 88 on Jan. 1.

Julien was best known for his role as Goldie in the 1973 film â€œThe Mack.â€ He also appeared in 1970â€™s â€œGetting Straightâ€ and 1997â€™s â€œDef Jamâ€™s How to Be a Playerâ€ and wrote 1973â€™s â€œCleopatra Jones.â€

Dan Reeves

Jan. 19, 1944-Jan. 1, 2022

NFL legend Dan Reeves died at age 77 on Jan. 1 of dementia complications.

Reeves was a running back for the Dallas Cowboys from 1965 to 1972. He played in nine Super Bowls, winning in 1972 against the Miami Dolphins. Reeves went on to coach teams including the Cowboys, Denver Broncos and New York Giants before retiring in 2003.
